name: Andrew Weatherall
description:
'''Andrew James Weatherall''' (6 April 1963 – 17 February 2020) was an English musician, DJ, songwriter, producer and remixer. His career took him from being a DJ in the [[acid house]] movement of the late 1980s to being a remixer of tracks by [[Happy Mondays]], [[New Order (band)|New Order]], [[Björk]], [[the Orb]], [[the Future Sound of London]], [[My Bloody Valentine (band)|My Bloody Valentine]], [[Saint Etienne (band)|Saint Etienne]], [[Primal Scream]], [[Moby]] and [[James (band)|James]].

His production work on [[Primal Scream]]'s album ''[[Screamadelica]]'', adding samples, loops and creating an influential mix of [[hard rock]], [[house music|house]] and [[rave music|rave]], helped the record win the first ever [[Mercury Music Prize]] in 1992 and become one of the most celebrated albums of the 1990s.
